essentials

Class Settings

  • java.lang.Object
    • essentials.Settings

  • public class Settings
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple class for keeping a Properties object in sync with a .properties or .xml file
    Author:
    Maximilian von Gaisberg

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Settings(java.io.File file, java.util.Properties defaultValues, boolean useXML, SimpleLog log)
      Use this to read a config file.

      Checks if a Settings object contains all the given keys

      Reads a String from the file and splits it into pieces to fit in an array.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Settings

        public Settings(java.io.File file,
                java.util.Properties defaultValues,
                boolean useXML,
                SimpleLog log)
        Use this to read a config file.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to be read
        defaultValues - The values that should be used if the file is broken or missing
        useXML - You can choose between .xml and .properties files
        log - The log that should be logged to

    • Method Detail

      • getSetting

        public java.lang.String getSetting(java.lang.String key)
        Get a setting from the config file
        Parameters:
        key - The key of the value that should be read in
        Returns:
        The value of the given setting

      • setSetting

        public void setSetting(java.lang.String key,
                       java.lang.String value)
        Set a setting. The config file will be automatically updated
        Parameters:
        key - The key of the setting
        value - The value of the setting

      • getArray

        public java.lang.String[] getArray(java.lang.String key)
        Reads a String from the file and splits it into pieces to fit in an array. Strings will be split on linebreaks, punctuation characters or whitespace characters
        Parameters:
        key - The key that represents the value
        Returns:
        The String[] that was stored in the Settings file

      • setComment

        public boolean setComment(java.lang.String comment,
                          boolean updateNow)
        Add a comment to the beginning of the file. Will only be added if you call .setSetting() or .writeToFile() afterwards or set 'updateNow' to true
        Parameters:
        comment - The comment that should be written in the head of the file
        updateNow - if true, the comment will be written to the file right now
        Returns:
        success

      • getProperties

        public java.util.Properties getProperties()
        Get the properties object. If you modify values in this object it won't be automatically synced to the file. Use .writeToFile() to do so
        Returns:
        The Properties object

      • setProperties

        public void setProperties(java.util.Properties p)
        Set the properties object. It will be synced to the file if you use writeToFile();
        Parameters:
        p - The properties object ot be synced

      • writeToFile

        public boolean writeToFile()
        Sync all values to the file. Not necessary if you use .setSetting()
        Returns:
        success

      • reload

        public void reload()
        Reloads the file manually

      • containsKeys

        public boolean containsKeys(java.lang.String[] keys)
        Checks if a Settings object contains all the given keys
        Parameters:
        keys - The keys to check for
        Returns:
        true if all of them are in the Settings object

      • containsKey

        public boolean containsKey(java.lang.String key)
        Check if the Settings Object contains a given key
        Parameters:
        key - The key to check for
        Returns:
        true if the key is present
